parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.26

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Math - Vectors

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns normalized vector (unit vector, [[vectorMagnitude]] <template><title>=</title></template><template><title>=</title></template> 1) of given vector. If given vector is 0 result is a 0 vector as well.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[vectorNormalized]] vector

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vector: [[Array]] - vector 3D or 2D (since Arma 3 v1.99.146539, z coordinate is defaulted to 0)

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[vectorNormalized]] [12345,7890,38383]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[0.300481,0.192045,0.934254]</value></part></template>
[[vectorMagnitude]] [0.300481,0.192045,0.934254]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value/></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[vectorDiff]], [[vectorCrossProduct]], [[vectorDotProduct]], [[vectorCos]], [[vectorMagnitude]], [[vectorMagnitudeSqr]], [[vectorMultiply]], [[vectorDistance]], [[vectorDistanceSqr]], [[vectorDir]], [[vectorUp]], [[setVectorDir]], [[setVectorUp]], [[setVectorDirAndUp]], [[vectorFromTo]], [[matrixMultiply]], [[matrixTranspose]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 19 Jul, 2014</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5| ffur2007slx2_5]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
<template lineStart="1"><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.26</value></part></template> Algorithm:
<code>Vector = [x,y,z]; 
Result = [x/([[sqrt]] (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2)), y/([[sqrt]] (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2)), z/([[sqrt]] (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2))];</code>
In mathematics, a unit vector in a normed vector space is a vector whose length is 1.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl></root>
